item.title: Could the EU be considering the formation of a military force, and would the UK have the power to block it?
item.description:
Steve Peers Recent discussions have centered around whether the EU is forming an army and if the UK has the power to veto such a move before Brexit. This debate, while heated, often lacks clarity. This piece aims to provide a clear understanding of the situation, concluding that the recent proposals don’t constitute an EU army, making a UK veto irrelevant. Background The EU’s foreign policy initially avoided defense matters, respecting Irish neutrality and the UK’s commitment to NATO...
